headline: Paramount Sweetens Warner Bros. Bid Terms to Woo Investors
summary: Paramount said in a statement on Tuesday it will cover the $2.8 billion termination fee that Warner Bros. will have to pay to Netflix if it ends the already agreed-upon deal with the streaming giant.  It will also backstop a Warner Bros. debt refinancing and pay $1.5 billion in fees associated with that, if necessary.

raw.headline: Paramount Sweetens Warner Bros. Bid Terms to Woo Investors

It will also backstop a Warner Bros. debt refinancing and pay $1.5 billion in fees associated with that, if necessary.

headline: Has Apollo Global Management (APO) Pullback Created A Fresh Valuation Opportunity For Investors
summary: If you are wondering whether Apollo Global Management's current share price lines up with its underlying value, you are not alone. That is exactly what this article will unpack. The stock last closed at US$133.95, with returns of 0.6% over 7 days, an 8.1% decline over 30 days, an 8.6% decline year to date and a 16.2% decline over 1 year, set against a very large gain over 5 years of about 2x. Recent coverage around Apollo has focused on its position as a large alternative asset manager and...

headline: Apollo Expands Wealth Reach And AI Credit Bet With Schroders And xAI
summary: Apollo Global Management (NYSE:APO) has agreed a partnership with Schroders to create hybrid public private market products for wealth and retirement clients. The firm is also a key financier in a multi billion dollar AI chip leasing deal that will supply infrastructure to xAI. These moves expand Apollo's presence in both traditional asset management channels and non traditional lending tied to AI infrastructure. Apollo Global Management comes into these deals with its shares at $133.95 and...

headline: Apollo Names Diego De Giorgi as Incoming Head of EMEA
summary: LONDON and NEW YORK, Feb. 10, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Apollo (NYSE: APO) today announced that industry veteran Diego De Giorgi will join the firm as a Partner and Head of EMEA. De Giorgi will succeed longtime Apollo Partner Rob Seminara in the role, who will remain in the region to support a successful transition before assuming new, global responsibilities for Apollo later this year. De Giorgi has spent more than 30 years in London serving in key leadership positions for large global banks. As
